SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.ckd

Interface DxCodes

All Superinterfaces:
org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlTokenSource
All Known Implementing Classes:
DxCodesImpl
public interface DxCodes extends org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject
Diagnostic codes configuration interface for CKD patient identification. This XMLBeans-generated interface manages collections of diagnostic codes (ICD-9/ICD-10) used to identify patients with Chronic Kidney Disease and related conditions. These codes are essential for automated patient screening, risk stratification, and population health management within the EMR system. The diagnostic codes are used by the CKD clinical decision support system to: - Identify patients with existing CKD diagnoses - Flag patients with risk factors for CKD development - Track CKD progression stages (Stage 1-5) - Monitor related complications (hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease) Each code entry includes the code value, type (ICD-9 or ICD-10), and an optional descriptive name for human readability.
Since:
2010-01-01

  • Method Details

    • getCodeArray

      DxCodes.Code[] getCodeArray()
      Gets all diagnostic codes as an array. Returns the complete collection of diagnostic codes configured for CKD patient identification. Each code represents a specific diagnosis that may indicate CKD or related conditions.
      Returns:
      Code[] array of all configured diagnostic codes

    • getCodeArray

      DxCodes.Code getCodeArray(int p0)
      Gets a specific diagnostic code by index. Retrieves a single diagnostic code from the collection at the specified position. Used for iterating through or accessing specific codes.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index of the code to retrieve
      Returns:
      Code diagnostic code at the specified index
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • sizeOfCodeArray

      int sizeOfCodeArray()
      Gets the number of diagnostic codes. Returns the total count of diagnostic codes in the configuration. Useful for iteration and validation purposes.
      Returns:
      int number of diagnostic codes configured

    • setCodeArray

      void setCodeArray(DxCodes.Code[] p0)
      Sets the entire array of diagnostic codes. Replaces all existing diagnostic codes with the provided array. This operation completely overwrites the current configuration.
      Parameters:
      p0 - Code[] array of diagnostic codes to set

    • setCodeArray

      void setCodeArray(int p0, DxCodes.Code p1)
      Sets a specific diagnostic code at an index. Updates or replaces the diagnostic code at the specified position in the collection.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index where to set the code
      p1 - Code diagnostic code to set at the position
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • insertNewCode

      DxCodes.Code insertNewCode(int p0)
      Inserts a new diagnostic code at a specific index. Creates and inserts a new empty Code instance at the specified position, shifting existing codes to make room. The returned instance can be populated with code details.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index where to insert the new code
      Returns:
      Code newly created code instance at the insertion point

    • addNewCode

      DxCodes.Code addNewCode()
      Adds a new diagnostic code to the collection. Creates and appends a new empty Code instance to the end of the diagnostic codes collection. The returned instance can be configured with the specific diagnostic code details.
      Returns:
      Code newly created code instance

    • removeCode

      void removeCode(int p0)
      Removes a diagnostic code at a specific index. Deletes the diagnostic code at the specified position from the collection, shifting remaining codes to fill the gap.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index of the code to remove
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid
